Definition.WordDefinition: Bhagavad-Gita n : (Hinduism) the sacred `song of God' composed about 200 BC and incorporated into the Mahabharata (a Sanskrit epic); contains a discussion between Krishna and the Indian hero Arjuna on human nature and the purpose of life [syn: {Bhagavadgita}, {Gita}]

Bhagavadgita n : (Hinduism) the sacred `song of God' composed about 200 BC and incorporated into the Mahabharata (a Sanskrit epic); contains a discussion between Krishna and the Indian hero Arjuna on human nature and the purpose of life [syn: {Bhagavad-Gita}, {Gita}]
